thread.title: Duke downs UNC, and if you bailed on the Blue Devils early, you made a mistake - CBSSports.com
thread.title_full: Duke downs UNC, and if you bailed on the Blue Devils early, you made a mistake - CBSSports.com

author: Gary Parrish
title: Duke downs UNC, and if you bailed on the Blue Devils early, you made a mistake - CBSSports.com
text:
Duke downs UNC, and if you bailed on the Blue Devils early, you made a mistake Coach K has his squad right back in the national title conversation 42m ago • 1 min read 
The top three freshmen started the season sidelined by injuries -- and one of them still isn't right. The leading returning scorer has been banged up, suspended and reduced to an internet meme. The Hall of Fame coach missed seven games because of back surgery. And folks have had a good time mocking Duke's struggles. 
But now look. 
The Blue Devils spent Thursday night beating North Carolina 86-78 inside a packed and wild Cameron Indoor Stadium to extend their winning streak to four games. They're now 19-5 overall, 15-2 with Mike Krzyzewski on the sideline and starting to take form as a true national title contender. 
Yes, Grayson Allen got the last laugh in this one. 
An uncreative North Carolina fan, in advance of the rivalry game, published a video in which he dressed up as Allen and tripped people around campus. Then, presumably, that same uncreative North Carolina fan watched the CBS Sports Preseason National Player of the Year drop a game-high 25 points on the Tar Heels before fouling out with 62 seconds remaining. Allen made seven 3-pointers in the win. He's gone 20-of-41 from beyond the arc in Duke's four-game winning streak. That's 48.8 percent. 
"Feels great," Allen said in a televised interview. "There's nothing like winning at home in a big game like this." 
Jayson Tatum added 19 points -- all of which came in the second half. 
He did this to UNC's Kennedy Meeks ... UNC-Duke debut✔️ Poster Kennedy Meeks✔️ #SCtop10 pic.twitter.com/8y3eX4oMiA
